title: Anisette
name: anisette-v1
steps: Add grain alcoholto a container with the gentian root and dandelion root and let steep for about two weeks, tasting until the bitter is just under the final level.
Add all remaining dried ingredients and let steep for one week, tasting until flavors are all present.
Add all fresh ingrients, and let steep for two to five days, until all flavors are properly balanced.
Make 2 cups of 1-to-1 simple syrup. Allow to cool completely.
Strain out all solids with a fine mesh strainer. Continue straining in multiple stages with paper towels and coffee filters until no visible particales are left.
Add the simple syrup and 4 cups of water to the amaro and mix. Distribute into as many jars and bottles as needed and allow to sit for two weeks to let flavors meld together.
A final filter pass may be necessary to remove settled particulate.
